subject: Home & DIY
title: Smart Thermostats Save 10-15% on Energy Bills
description: A short lesson to help you apply Smart Thermostats Save 10-15% on Energy Bills.

hook.text: A smart thermostat learns you leave at 8 AM and drops heat at 7:45. It pre-heats before you return at 6 PM.

buildup.text: Old thermostats hold one temperature all dayâ€”even when nobody's home. That wastes 20-30% of heating and cooling.

discovery.text: Smart thermostats use occupancy sensors, geolocation, and weather data to optimize schedules automatically.

twist.text: Nest's 'green leaf' icon nudges users toward lower temps. Behavioral design saves as much energy as the algorithm.

climax.text: US households save $131-$145 yearly with a smart thermostat. The device pays for itself in under two years.

punchline.text: The best thermostat heats the house you're in, not the one you left.

quiz.question: How do smart thermostats know when to start pre-heating your home?
options: They use phone geolocation, occupancy sensors, and learned schedules
They measure outside temperature and calculate heat-up time
They follow a fixed schedule you program once during setup
